item.title: The Sector Episode 28: More Politics More Direct Mail on 21-Nov-2014
item.description: The Sector Episode 28: More Politics More Direct Mail - Vancouver's recent civic elections, plus we discuss the latest aggressive rhetoric about environmentalists from the conservative party, as well as Kim Campbell's plan to bring more women into politics. And we have another live opening of direct mail from UBC, what do they have to say this time?
item.itunes:subtitle: The Sector Episode 28: More Politics More Direct Mail - Vancouver's recent civic elections, plus the latest aggressive rhetoric about environmentalists from the conservative party, as well as Kim Campbell's plan to bring more women into politics. Live ope

item.title: The Sector Episode 27: Poppies and Direct Mail on 14-Nov-2014
item.description: The Sector Episode 27: Poppies and Direct Mail - We discuss the significance of Remembrance Day and Poppies, and we do a live opening of two pieces of Direct Mail!
item.itunes:subtitle: The Sector Episode 27: Poppies and Direct Mail - We discuss the significance of Remembrance Day and Poppies, and we do a live opening of two pieces of Direct Mail!

item.title: The Sector Episode 26: Women Moving Millions on 31-Oct-2014
item.description: The Sector Episode 26: Women Moving Millions - We have an interview with Jacki Zehner of Women Moving Millions. Nonprofit news including the Gay mayor of Huston, Annise Parker, flooded with bibles, and the UBC AMS reaches quorum for the first time in nearly 40 years as students oppose tuition hike.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Sector Episode 26: Women Moving Millions - Interview with Jacki Zehner of Women Moving Millions, Gay mayor of Huston flooded with bibles, UBC AMS reaches quorum and students oppose tuition hike

item.title: The Sector Episode 25: Volunteer Canada on 24-Oct-2014
item.description: The Sector Episode 25: Volunteer Canada - we discuss the recent shooting in Ottawa and how this is a time to make sure we don't damage civil liberties for a false sense of security. Also, research on the CRA audits comparing left and right leaning charities, plus an interview on Employee Supported Volunteering with Paula Speevak of Volunteer Canada.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Sector Episode 25: Volunteer Canada - Shooting in Ottawa, Research on CRA Audits, and Employee Supported Volunteering with Paula Speevak of Volunteer Canada

item.title: The Sector Episode 24: BC Gov vs Nonprofits on 18-Oct-2014
item.description: The Sector Episode 24: BC Gov vs Nonprofits - The BC Government is proposing a new Societies Act which will allow nonprofits to be sued by corporations or special interest groups. Ethan discusses Doctors without Borders as they battle Ebola. Plus, Gamergate and social justice.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Sector Episode 24: BC Gov vs Nonprofits - BC Gov allowing nonprofits to be sued anytime by anyone, Doctors without Borders battles Ebola, Gamergate and social justice

item.title: The Sector Episode 23: The War on Drugs on 10-Oct-2014
item.description: The Sector Episode 23: The War on Drugs - Seattle Changes Columbus Day, UBC Activism, The War on Drugs, with a segment from the Terry Project Podcast
item.itunes:subtitle: The Sector Episode 23: The War on Drugs - Seattle Changes Columbus Day, UBC Activism, The War on Drugs, with a segment from the Terry Project Podcast

item.title: The Sector Episode 22: Who Works Harder? Millennials or Gen X on 03-Oct-2014
item.description: The Sector Episode 22: Who Works Harder: Millennials or Gen X - Update on Scottish Independence, Environmentalists more dangerous than terrorists? CRA not auditing conservative think tanks, and workplace demographics of who works harder. Millennials or Gen X?

item.title: The Sector Episode 21: HAVE Culinary Society on 12-Sep-2014
item.description: The Sector Episode 21: HAVE Culinary Society - We discuss the possibility of an independent Scotland, how that relates to centralism vs decentralism government. Plus an interview with Glen Lamont of HAVE Culinary Training Society, a social enterprise which operates in Vancouver's DTES.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Sector Episode 21: HAVE Culinary Society - We discuss the possibility of an independent Scotland, plus an interview with Glen Lamont of HAVE Culinary Training Society

item.title: The Sector Episode 20: Why Do We Need Unions? on 05-Sep-2014
item.description: The Sector Episode 20: Why Do We Need Unions? - What's in your pumpkin spiced latte? Political bias for charities, is narcissism bad for philanthropy? And why do we need unions?
item.itunes:subtitle: The Sector Episode 20: Why Do We Need Unions? - What's in your pumpkin spiced latte? Political bias for charities, is narcissism bad for philanthropy? And why do we need unions?

item.title: The Sector Episode 19: A Sociological View on Crime on 29-Aug-2014
item.description: The Sector Episode 19: A Sociological View on Crime - We consider the ALS Ice Bucket Challenge, and take a look at the popular infographic on funding vs diseases. After a musical interlude, we examine the need for a sociological view on crime.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Sector Episode 19: A Sociological View on Crime - We consider the ALS Ice Bucket Challenge, and take a look at the popular infographic on funding vs diseases. After a musical interlude, we examine the need for a sociological view on crime.

item.title: The Sector Episode 18: Corporate Social Responsibility on 15-Aug-2014
item.description: The Sector Episode 18: Corporate Social Responsibility - the latest news on charities and the CRA, Robin Williams and mental health, the Big Question of the Week and more!
item.itunes:subtitle: The Sector Episode 18: Corporate Social Responsibility - the latest news on charities and the CRA, Robin Williams and mental health, the Big Question of the Week and more!

item.title: The Sector Episode 17: The Engagement Pyramid on 08-Aug-2014

item.itunes:subtitle: The Sector Episode 17: The Engagement Pyramid - Terry Fox Day in Manitoba, Aussie Advocacy Chill, Nonprofit influencers, and the Engagement Pyramid

item.title: The Sector Episode 16: IRS vs CRA on 01-Aug-2014
item.description: The Sector Episode 16: IRS vs CRA - Which organization wins? the IRS or the CRA?? More discussion on the Advocacy Chill and how regulators can help nonprofits! Comparisons between Canada and America when it comes to a nonprofit/charity political advocacy.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Sector Episode 16: IRS vs CRA - Which organization wins? the IRS or the CRA?? More discussion on the Advocacy Chill and how regulators can help nonprofits!

item.title: The Sector Episode 15: Engagement and the Advocacy Chill on 25-Jul-2014
item.description: The Sector Episode 15: Engagement and the Advocacy Chill - The Big Question, What is "Engagement" and what does it do? Plus, the Advocacy Chill, are nonprofits being "targeted" by government for speaking out against government policy? Is the CRA tacitly involved in this?
item.itunes:subtitle: The Sector Episode 15: Engagement and the Advocacy Chill - The Big Question, What is "Engagement" and what does it do? Plus, the Advocacy Chill, are nonprofits being "targeted" by government?

item.title: The Sector Episode 14: Dissecting Direct Mail on 11-Jul-2014
item.description: The Sector Episode 14: Dissecting Direct Mail - The Big Question "does protesting work?" The role of empathy in donating and how it can turn on you. Plus a live analysis of UBC's direct mail to Alumni donors. Does it make the grade?
item.itunes:subtitle: The Sector Episode 14: Dissecting Direct Mail - The Big Question "does protesting work?", the role of empathy in donating, a live analysis of UBC's direct mail

item.title: The Sector Episode 13: Charity Science on 04-Jul-2014
item.description: The Sector Episode 13: Charity Science - An interview with Xio Kikauka the executive director of Charity Science. Other topics include, are sports teams that use first nations names racist? Also the Big Question of the Week, the Pitch of the Week
item.itunes:subtitle: The Sector Episode 13: Charity Science - An interview with Xio Kikauka the exec director of Charity Science. Are sports teams that use first nations names racist? Also the Big Question of the Week, the Pitch of the Week

item.title: The Sector Episode 12: Music Heals on 20-Jun-2014
item.description: The Sector Episode 12: Music Heals - The Big Question of the week, what type of fundraising annoys people the most? Nonprofit news tells us that giving to religious groups is down in 2013. And we have an interview with Chris Brandt of Music Heals.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Sector Episode 12: Music Heals - What type of fundraising annoys people the most? Giving to religious groups goes down. Interview with Chris Brandt of Music Heals.

item.description: The Sector Episode 9: The Donor Pyramid - The Sector returns for a week off, the recent shooting and misogynist terrorism, the donor pyramid and is it time to retire it?

item.description: Interview with Brad Peters from Dying with Dignity, including his Pitch of the Week. Other topics for the show include the "Fair" Elections Act, Net Neutrality and answer the Big Question.

item.description: This week we have an interview with David LePage about Social Enterprise and what is the blended return on investment? Also: remembering Farley Mowat, discussing gender in nonprofits and charities, as well as the Big Question of the Week.

item.description: Interview with Vanessa Chase, nonprofit consultant and author of the Story-telling nonprofit. We also discuss listener feedback on overhead, as well as the recent news of the Portland Hotel Society. And the Pitch of the Week and The Big Question of the Week.
